metadata.titel_preek: Der Glaube arbeitet an der Angst

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The transformation of human fear into productive energy (faith) through psychological processing and social engagement.

tekstueel_bewijs: Wir können die Energie unserer Ängste... gebrauchen zu andern Dingen
aus dem Gefängnis einen Versammlungsraum machen
ein produktives Instrument, ein Instrument des Friedens und der Gerechtigkeit machen
Jesus ist nicht unser Herr, sondern unser Bruder und unser Freund

ontvanger.identificatie: The Oppressed / The World / The Hearer
tekstueel_bewijs: sich gründlicher auf die Unterdrückten und die Ausgebeuteten in der ganzen Welt einzulassen
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: Subject (The one who must work on fear)

helper.identificatie: Groups / Psychoanalytic Theory / The 'Stream of Love'
tekstueel_bewijs: Die wirkliche Verwandlung der Ängste... geschieht in Gruppen
mit Hilfe der psychoanalytischen Theorie eine Erklärung für Angst bekommen
helper.rol_van_god: God is an 'Environment' (Stream of Love) rather than an active Subject.

tekstueel_bewijs: Welt, die aus Profitinteresse und Aggression aufgebaut ist
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: Sin is defined as social separation and psychological repression, not as a cosmic power or enmity with God.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The 'Soteriological' background: God assuring the human that they are not alone.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: God
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The primary program (human processing) consumes the secondary program. God's action is reduced to a psychological 'state' that enables the human subject to work.

voorbeelden_god_subject: Gott sagt uns, du bist nicht allein
Gott... will uns an diesen Stromkreis der Liebe anschließen
voorbeelden_mens_subject: Wir müssen natürlich wissen, wozu man den Pflug... braucht

voorbeelden: mit Hilfe der psychoanalytischen Theorie eine Erklärung bekommen

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon is a 'manual' for psychological transformation. It assumes that if the hearer understands the mechanics of fear (Savoir), they have the inherent power (Pouvoir) to retool it.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S2 (Fear) to ~S1 (Repression) to S1 (Faith as 'Work').
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Faith is redefined as the 'processing' (Bearbeitung) of fear into social action.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Moderate; fear is seen as energy to be redirected rather than a symptom of death.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While using the term 'faith', the sermon describes a human psychological process. God is the 'stream' (infrastructure), but the Human is the 'worker' (Subject).

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: Der Glaube arbeitet an der Angst... Er bearbeitet sie.
die Energie unserer Ängste... gebrauchen zu andern Dingen

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: du bist nie allein, du bist auch im Sterben nicht allein

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Jesus is presented as the model for how to handle fear (not being naive, but processing it).
bijbelse_figuren_als_model: Jesus (as the one who sweats blood but 'works' through it)
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Jesus as the one who conquers the chaos-waters because humans are paralyzed by fear.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Pressure to 'process' fear correctly; faith becomes a task.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Synergism where the human provides the 'work' and God provides the 'electricity'.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: Highly coherent as a psychological-political manifesto, but theologically disconnected from the biblical text's christology.
spanning_punten: Jesus as 'Brother' vs. the Jesus who commands the wind and sea in the text.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus soll uns dahin bringen, dass auch wir eines Tages sagen können...

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is social inequality and psychological repression.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon shifts the Subject from God/Christ to the human 'worker of faith'.

subject_herpositionering.huidige_probleem: The human is the one 'working' on fear.
subject_herpositionering.voorgestelde_herpositionering: Christ as the Subject who stills the storm that we cannot process.
subject_herpositionering.voorbeeld_revisie: Instead of 'Faith works on fear', use 'Christ's word silences the storm of our fear'.

identificatie_herstel.strategie: Emphasize the disciples' total helplessness in the boat.

modale_balans.huidige_onbalans: Savoir (Knowledge of psychology) and Pouvoir (Ability to change).
modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Pouvoir (God's power) given to the powerless.
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Focus on the 'Gabe' (Gift) of faith rather than the 'Arbeit' (Work) of faith.

tegenstander_intensivering.voorgestelde_intensivering: Fear as a manifestation of the 'Chaos' that only God can rebuke.
tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: If fear is just energy, we don't need a Savior, just a therapist.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.probleem: Ethics (social work) is fused with Soteriology (faith).
narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: 1. Christ stills the storm (Soteriology). 2. Therefore, we can walk on land in peace (Ethics).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon is rhetorically strong and socially relevant, but structurally anthropocentric. It turns the Gospel into a psychological technique.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorically, the sermon is persuasive and empathetic; actantially, it is a law-driven mandate.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis would focus on Jesus' authority over creation; this sermon focuses on human authority over the psyche.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas reveals that 'Faith' here functions as a verb of human labor rather than a noun of divine gift.

appendices.notities: The sermon is a classic example of 'Liberal Moralism' where the vocabulary is religious but the actantial engine is secular-humanistic.
